content:
• Friday, June 30, 2017
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships announces 1-for-7 reverse split

    • Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) -22.7% AH after announcing a one-for-seven reverse stock split, after the measure was approved yesterday at company's annual shareholder meeting.
    • The action will reduce the number of outstanding common shares to ~2.1M from 14.4M shares.
    • The reverse split will take effect at the open on July 5.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 11 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: ACM +4.8%. BCRX +2.5%. AKBA +1.9%. BSM +1.5%. NAP +1.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: SFUN -3.0%. QHC -3.0%. NRP -2.5%. RAD -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • DRYS

    DryShips starts first VLGC time charter with an oil major

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) sank another 25% in today's trade even after announcing the beginning of its first very large gas carrier five-year firm time charter with an unnamed oil major.
    • The company expects a total gross backlog associated with the time charter of as much as $92.7M, when including options to extend the firm employment period by up to three years.
    • DRYS +4.7% AH following the latest Kalani Investments update, which shows three-month sales of more than 14.8M shares at an average $8.94/share for an aggregate gross purchase price of $132.4M.
    • But following six reverse stock splits in a year, DRYS continued its inexorable plunge today to a new intraday low of $1.26; its market cap now totals $5.43M vs. a split-adjusted all-time high $212M, Bespoke says.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 17 Comments
  • MTOR

    Meritor sets conversion option on some senior notes

    • Meritor (NYSE:MTOR) has set a conversion option on its 7.875% convertible senior notes due 2026.
    • Holders are being notified that beginning tomorrow and running through the close of business Sept. 29, they can convert those notes at a rate of 83.3333 shares of common stock per $1,000 principal.
    • That leads to a conversion price of about $12/share. Shares closed up 1.7% today to $16.61 in NYSE trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron price target boosted at BTIG

    • Regeneron (NASDAQ:REGN) shares fell off 3.7% today in spite of a price target raise from BTIG.
    • The firm rates Regeneron a Buy and hiked its target to $540 from a previous $480, as it anticipates positive results from its nesvacumab antibody and eczema therapy dupilumab studies.
    • Price targets have been rising this week even from neutral firms. Bernstein downgraded shares to Market Perform from Outperform Monday, but boosted its target to $480 from $410.
    • Meanwhile on Wednesday, Leerink Swann reiterated its Outperform rating and raised its target to $573 from $493, implying 16.7% upside from today's lower close.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 7 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: OIL +8.0%. USO +7.2%. BNO +6.6%. DBC +4.6%. DBA +4.2%.
    • Top losers: GDX -2.9%. IDU -2.9%. XLK -2.0%. QQQ -2.5%. GDXJ -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 9 Comments
  • NXE

    Nexgen Energy +8% after securing $110M in financing

    • NextGen Energy (NXE +8.4%) shoots higher after receiving a second financing package totaling $110M from CEF Holdings, consisting of ~24.2M shares priced at $2.07 each and $60M in unsecured convertible debentures.
    • NXE says proceeds from the financing will be used to fund the continuing exploration and development of its SW2 properties, which includes the Rook 1 project, and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SUBCY

    Subsea 7 picks up assets from bankrupt EMAS Chiyoda Subsea

    • Subsea 7 (OTCPK:SUBCY +3.1%) agrees to acquire certain business and assets of EMAS Chiyoda Subsea out of a U.S. Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceeding for less than $100M.
    • Subsea 7 says the acquired businesses will allow it to expand operations in the Middle East via the assumption of three current projects and a long-term agreement in Saudi Arabia.
    • The company says it acquired ~$850M in backlog orders, including five projects each with backlog exceeding $50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:10 pm

    • Gainers: PTI +10%. WEB +10%. SMI +8%. GVP +7%. INSG +7%.
    • Losers: MOSY -28%. IPDN -14%. ELSE -8%. VJET -9%. EXFO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • WBA

    Rite Aid looks to next phase

    • The FTC is still likely to get involved in the reworked deal between Walgreen Boots Alliance (WBA -0.2%) and Rite Aid (RAD -2.9%), according to a D.C. antitrust attorney.
    • "They can’t create a situation where the remaining Rite Aid stores, whatever that looks like, are not going to be competitively significant," says Andrea Agathoklis Murino.
    • Working in Rite Aid's favor is the huge cash stack that it will bring in from the sale of 2,186 stores -- an amount that it can be argued will help reposition its as a competitive chain.
    • "It really gives them a lifeline whereas there probably wasn’t one if they had just gotten the deal scuttled and there was no transaction," notes Bloomberg Intelligence's Jonathan Palmer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 56 Comments
  • FSAM

    Further gains for FSC and FSFR after Fifth Street confirms discussions

    • Fifth Street Asset Management (OTCPK:FSAM) this morning confirmed it's in discussions regarding a potential sale, which would include management of Fifth Street Finance (FSC) and Fifth Street Floating Rate (FSFR).
    • FSAM today is flat after yesterday's big gain, but FSC is up another 6.2% and FSFR another 1.9%.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Fifth Street vehicles jump on report Oaktree is buying manager (June 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 5 Comments
  • BLUE

    Bluebird bio downgraded at BTIG as abundance of good news priced in

    • Bluebird bio (BLUE -2.7%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at BTIG Research, which says a string of much anticipated events already are baked into the drug maker’s share price.
    • BLUE has soared higher by more than 70% YTD following favorable data updates in its oncology and rare disease efforts, and BTIG believes the stock price has "generally captured" these updates; the company will have another round of updates from key programs at ASH during December and an update on CCALD at a yet to be named neurology conference during H2.
    • BTIG also downgrades Celgene (CELG -1.1%), BLUE's partner in the development of the bb2121 experimental cancer drug, to Neutral from Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras to adjust diesel, gasoline prices more frequently

    • Petrobras (PBR +1.8%) says it will begin adjusting domestic diesel and gasoline prices more frequently, possibly even on a daily basis, as it seeks to introduce greater flexibility to compete with private importers.
    • The new plan, which goes into effect Monday, replaces a policy PBR introduced in October of reviewing fuel prices monthly; previously, the company had updated prices only sporadically and provided little transparency about its decision making process, and at times it burned billions of dollars a year effectively subsidizing imported energy products.
    • Separately, PBR says its E&P, refining and logistics operations are normal despite a nationwide strike in Brazil.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 3 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: BCEI +8%. CC +7%. TROX +7%. SHLM +7%. CRZO +7%.
    • Losers: CRC -6%. NOG -5%. WMLP-OLD -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • KERX

    Rising Auryxia prescriptions at Keryx Pharma; Shares +2%

    • According to Symphony Health Solutions, Auryxia prescriptions rose 10.5% in the week ended June 23 from the previous week. That would be the fastest pace of scripts since sales began nearly three years ago.
    • KERX +2.35%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 11 Comments
  • NKE

    Susquehanna lauds 'innovation engine' at Nike

    • Susquehanna analyst Sam Poser doles out high praise to Nike (NKE +9.6%) after the company delivered FQ4 results and guidance ahead of expectations.
    • "We are certainly beginning to see the fruits of Nike's efforts to re-ignite its innovation engine with initial success of new platforms such as VaporMax and Zoom X, DD growth in Sportswear, and a return to growth in Basketball," writesPoser.
    • "We are also seeing how the diversification of Nike's model is paying dividends, as revenue growth for every single geography outside of North America was above our forecast," he adds.
    • Previously: Global markets help Nike fly past estimates (June 29)
    • Previously: Nike beats by $0.10, beats on revenue (June 29)
    • Previously: Nike rallies after solid guidance, Amazon pilot update (June 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 9 Comments

  • Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: PKY +12%. PN +9%. CPSS +8%. PMTS +6%. CIA +5%. MARPS +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: WMAR +33%. QPAC +27%. SKLN +19%. OBSV +13%. CVM +13%. PKY +12%. ALBO +12%. DCO +10%. PN +10%. IDSA +9%.
    • Losers: CARA -37%. DEST -30%. SPEX -29%. MOSY -29%. MBRX -25%. NXTD -23%. DRYS -12%. CIDM -12%. LENS -10%. TTNP -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 4 Comments
  • BAYRY

    Bayer warning has read-through for Brazil-exposed fertilizer firms, Stifel says

    • Bayer’s (OTCPK:BAYRY -4.2%) profit warning related to its Brazilian crop sciences operations has potential read-through for fertilizer companies with exposure to the Brazilian agriculture market, Stifel says, pointing to Mosaic (MOS) as having the most exposure among peers.
    • Stifel says it remains to be seen whether the market will see reduced demand for the season or just a temporary shift in the seasonality of purchasing, but lower crop prices in U.S. dollar terms and rising input costs in local currency could prolong inventory overhangs.
    • Others with Brazilian exposure include Compass Minerals (CMP -0.8%), Agrium (AGU -0.5%), Potash Corp. (POT -0.5%) and CF Industries (CF -1.4%), although Stifel says CF has the least exposure given the Brazil’s relatively low consumption of nitrogen fertilizers compared to potash and phosphates.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 11 Comments
  • CARA

    Analyst keeps Buy rating for Cara Therapeutics despite trial disappointment

    • Not all analysts are ready to throw in the towel on Cara Therapeutics (CARA -34.1%) after the company missed the primary endpoint in the phase 2B clinical trial of its oral CR845 therapy for treatment of osteoarthritis pain.
    • H.C. Wainwright's Corey Davis says the trial "unequivocally showed" a positive signal in the pre-specified subset of patients with hip (but not knee) osteoarthritis, and more importantly, it showed an "incredibly benign side effect profile."
    • Davis keeps a Buy rating and $30 price target on the shares, saying the study "could have been far worse," and while not an obvious win that allows progression to Phase 3, the next step will be to conduct another Phase 2 with changes that can optimize the chances of CR845 showing clear efficacy.
    • Earlier: Sell-side weighs in as Cara Therapeutics dives nearly 30%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 40 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: NKE +9%. BSET +6%. VRA +5%.
    • Losers: WKHS -8%. AOI -8%. VOXX -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CBI

    CB&I completes Capital Services sale for amended $700M price

    • CB&I (CBI -6.4%) says it has completed the sale of its Capital Services business to an affiliate of P-E firm Veritas Capital for an amended $700M price; shares are halted.
    • CBI announced in February that it had sold the business, which provides maintenance and modification contractor services for the nuclear power industry, for $755M.
    • CBI says it will record an additional ~$50M non-cash pre-tax charge in Q2 to account for the change in the sale price.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 41 Comments
  • FNSR

    Davidson sees compelling value in Finisar, AAOI; shares rise

    • Optical component stocks are back on the rise today, recouping some ground lost in declines yesterday, as D.A. Davidson weighs in anew on the sector.
    • The firm initiated Finisar (FNSR +0.6%) and Applied Optoelectronics (AAOI +4.8%) at Buy, pointing to "compelling" valuations, and started coverage on NeoPhotonics (NPTN -7.3%) at Neutral.
    • It has a target price for Finisar of $40, implying 51.5% upside, and for Applied Optoelectronics of $95, also implying 51% upside.
    • Finisar has a "building presence in China that should drive strong growth" by the end of the year, along with solid OEM partnerships, writes Mark Kelleher. For its part, Applied Opto will see a favorable margin mix shift from smaller form factor transceivers as they grow.
    • His target on NeoPhotonics is $9, implying 11% upside from yesterday's close (and nearly 20% upside from today's lower price).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 14 Comments
  • DPW

    Digital Power soars 70%-plus on rising order backlog

    • Digital Power (DPW +72.2%) soars more than 70% higher after announcing that its customer order backlog has increased to more than $65M, $8M more than an update  issued in mid-May.
    • DPW attributes the increase to organic growth from new and current customers as well as the consolidation of financial reporting which now includes Microphase Corp.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: SKLN +21%. ALBO +15%. OBSV +11%. CVM +7%. CXRX-OLD +7%.
    • Losers: CARA -31%. MBRX -25%. DMTX -8%. TROV -7%. ZYNE -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • DDD

    3D, Stratasys down on analyst competition concerns

    • 3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) shares falling due to a note from William Blair analyst Brian Drab expresses caution about potential competition.
    • Drab met with 3-D printing industry representatives and found that some 3D distributors were switching to competitors like HP. 
    • He also notes that 3D lowering the reseller price for its consumable materials could put pressure on the segment’s margins. 
    • Drab says the same competition threats to 3D also apply to Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) and maintains an Underperform rating on both companies.
    • Source: Bloomberg 
    • 3D shares are down 5.55%. 
    • Stratasys shares are down 2.45%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 23 Comments
  • SRC

    Traders resuscitate Sears Canada

    • Sears Canada (NYSE:SRC) jumps 90% after the stock came off a trading halt due to volatility.
    • The extreme swing follows news from earlier this week that Sears Canada will be delisted from the Nasdaq on July 3 unless it files an appeal.
    • SRSC is still down 35% YTD.
    • Sears Holdings (SHLD +4.6%) still holds an 11.74% stake in the Canadian company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 22 Comments
  • SPI

    SPI Energy +54% after successful project grid connection

    • SPI Energy (SPI +54.3%) skyrockets following news of a successful grid connection at a 3.28 MW distributed generation project in China.
    • SPI has provided engineering, procurement and construction services for the project since February.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • RGR

    Gun stocks react to AOBC guidance

    • Soft guidance from American Outdoor Brands has investors selling Sturm Ruger (RGR -8.2%) and Vista Outdoors (VSTO -3%) on concerns over profit meeting expectations amid some promotional activity.
    • Previously: American Outdoor Brands beats by $0.20, beats on revenue (June 29)
    • Previously: Post-earnings slide for American Outdoor Brands (June 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 5 Comments
  • POL

    PolyOne sells plastic sheet business to P-E firm for $115M

    • PolyOne (POL +2.8%) is higher after agreeing to sell its Designed Structures and Solutions unit, which produces sheet, rollstock and packaging assets, to Arsenal Capital Partners for $115M.
    • The unit includes most of Spartech Corp., which POL acquired for nearly $400M in 2012, but it had struggled financially and posted a nearly $4M operating loss last year.
    • POL anticipates the sale will result in a $220M after-tax charge in Q2.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • AOBC

    Post-earnings slide for American Outdoor Brands

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC) is down sharply after the company's guidance for FY18 disappointed.
    • The company sees revenue of $750M to $790M for FY18 and EPS of $1.42 to $1.62. Both marks are short of consensus estimates.
    • "We believe the promotional atmosphere will continue and will have an impact on our gross margins, especially in Q1 and Q2," notes CEO James Debney.
    • we believe Q3 and Q4 will be positively impacted by upcoming new product introductions several of which are significant," he adds.
    • American Outdoor Brands earnings call transcript
    • Previously: American Outdoor Brands beats by $0.20, beats on revenue (June 29)
    • Shares of American Outdoor Brands are down 8.8% in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 4 Comments
  • APRN

    Blue Apron slips below $10

    • Blue Apron (NYSE:APRN) lost its double-digit trading handle seen by some investors as crucial.
    • The online food kit stock has to stand on its own for a while as the analyst quiet period doesn't expire until August 8.
    • Shares are down 2.10% to $9.79.
    • Previously: Blue Apron opens level with IPO pricing (June 29)
    • Previously: Bleak start for Blue Apron IPO (June 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • RAD

    Rite Aid spirals down again

    • Investment firms are downgrading Rite Aid (RAD -8.1%) this morning in reaction to the plug getting pulled on the Walgreens merger.
    • Evercore ISI issues an Underperform rating and calls out downside to $2 per share.
    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch is also at Underperform and sets a price target of $2.
    • Shares of Rite Aid hit a new 52-week low of $2.62 this morning, leading some traders to see value in a takeover scenario with Rite Aid's market cap threatening to drop below $2B.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 45 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • SKLN +31% on updating on Streamweay.
    • PKY +12% as Canada Pension Plan Investment Board makes big investrment.
    • HAIN +11% after Engaged Capital took a 10% stake.
    • NKE +6% after solid guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • CARA

    Sell-side weighs in as Cara Therapeutics dives nearly 30%

    • via Bloomberg
    • The retreat in the share price shouldn't be too much of a surprise, says H.C. Wainwright's Corey Davis, noting a near-doubling in the month leading up to the test results. The data, he says, is a "clear positive signal" for CR845's "incredibly benign side effect profile." He reiterates his Buy rating and $30 price target.
    • Also a bull, Piper Jaffray's Charles Duncan says the results are "clearly supportive" of further study, with a follow-up Phase 2b trial starting maybe as soon as this year. He's Overweight with a $27 price target.
    • Janney's Ken Trbovich downgrades to Neutral from Buy. He says the results signal development will take longer and cost more than expected, with the pivotal study now a 2019/2020 event vs. 2018.
    • CARA -26% to $18.83
    • Previously: Cara Therapeutics oral tablet version of pain candidate CR845 shows mixed results in mid-stage study; shares down 22% after hours (June 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 31 Comments

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • CARA -27% announcing on top-line results from Phase 2b trial of oral CR845.
    • MBRX -27%.
    • DEST -25%.
    • SPEX -20%.
    • NXTD -6%.
    • RAD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 10 Comments
  • PKY

    Parkway taken bout by CPPIB for $1.2B

    • The Canada Pension Plan Investment Board makes a big investment in Houston office property with the purchase of Parkway (NYSE:PKY) for $1.2B, or $23.05 per share, a 13% premium to last night's close.
    • TPG Capital owns nearly 10% of Parkway, and is in favor of the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks CFO exits for another company

    • Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK) announces that Pete Michielutti is stepping down from his positions as COO and CFO on July 14 to take a position with another company.
    • A search for a replacement will begin immediately.
    • CBK -2.96% premarket to $1.31.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • BAYRY

    Bayer lowers 2017 outlook as Brazilian crop unit struggles

    • Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) cuts its FY 2017 earnings outlook, citing high inventories at its Brazilian Crop Services business, a weak performance at its consumer health division and an unfavorable currency environment; shares -3.5% in Frankfurt trading after earlier falling as much as 5.6%.
    • Bayer guides 2017 adjusted EBITDA lower by €300M-€400M ($342M-$456M) mostly due to high stocks of crop protection products at the end of the harvest season in Brazil.
    • Bayer says its consumer health division is not performing as well as expected, without providing details, but the pharmaceuticals division and the Covestro plastics business are strong.
    • The reduced outlook comes as Bayer files a request for approval of its planned takeover of Monsanto (NYSE:MON) with European Union regulators.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 6 Comments
  • OCFC

    OceanFirst scoops up Sun Bancorp

    • In a merger of two NJ community banks, OceanFirst Bancorp (NASDAQ:OCFC) will purchase Sun Bancorp (NASDAQ:SNBC) in a deal valued at $487M, or $25.27 per SNBC share.
    • Consideration to Sun Bancorp owners will be 0.7884 shares of OCFC stock and $3.78 in cash for each share of OCFC they hold.
    • It's a few pennies higher than last night's close, and 169% of March 31 tangible book value per share.
    • A conference call (dial-in) is set for 10 ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • HAIN

    Hain +9% with activist in the house

    • Shares of Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN) are flying premarket trading after Engaged Capital took a 10% stake in the company and stated it would seek board seats.
    • A natural thought is that the activist firm will push Hain to consider a sale, but JPMorgan warns that an outright sale of the company is unlikely (per Bloomberg).
    • Keep an eye on the sensitive food sector today for some extra volatility with the activist talk in the air, TreeHouse Foods (NYSE:THS), B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) and Lancaster Colony (NASDAQ:LANC) in particular could be looked at by investors.
    • HAIN +8.59% premarket to $38.83 vs. a 52-week trading range of $31.01 to $56.99.
    • Previously: Engaged Capital discloses 10% stake in Hain Celestial (June 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM | 7 Comments
  • GILD

    Vertex Pharma again cited as potential Gilead target; shares up 2% premarket

    • Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD) could pay up to $230 per share for Vertex (NASDAQ:VRTX) and still see earnings accretiion, says Leerink's Geoffrey Porges. That's 80% higher than last night's close.
    • Gilead management, however, seems more interested in chasing the flood of capital being put to work in oncology, rather than a "de-risked" target like Vertex, and its cyber fibrosis franchise.
    • Vertex +2.15% to $130 premarket
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM | 42 Comments
  • PCRX

    Pacira Pharma to end production of DepoCyt(e); down 1.35% premarket

    • Due to persistent technical issues specific to the DepoCyt(e) manufacturing process, the company has decided to discontinue all future production.
    • A $5M Q2 charge is expected to be taken, $3.3M of which will be paid in cash.
    • The drug accounted for about 2.5% of company revenue in 2016.
    • PCRX -1.35% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM
  • BRK.A

    Berkshire to convert stake in BofA from preferred to common

    • As promised by Warren Buffett some months ago, Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) will exercise its warrants to buy 700M shares of Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) common stock once the just-announced dividend increase takes place.
    • The exercise price will be $7.14 per share vs. BoA's current price of $24.56 (up 1% premarket), and the move will make Berkshire (at 7%) the single largest holder of Bank of America.
    • Consideration will be the $5B of Bank of America preferred shares currently held by Berkshire.
    • Bank of America this week was approved for a hike in the annual dividend to $0.48 per share vs. the current $0.30. Buffett had said he would convert if the dividend rose above $0.44.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM | 90 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike rallies after solid guidance, Amazon pilot update

    • Nike (NYSE:NKE) confirms that it sell certain products on Amazon under a new pilot program. The partnership will start with a small product assortment across footwear in the U.S.
    • "We're in the early stages, but we really look forward to evaluating the results of the pilot," said CEO Mark Parker on the conference call.
    • Nike guidance: The company says it expects FY18 sales growth in the mid-to-high single digit range. Global futures orders were reported as flat vs. +1.25% consensus estimate. FY18 gross margin is seen narrowing by about 50 bps.
    • Nike earnings conference call transcript
    • Previously: Nike beats by $0.10, beats on revenue (June 29)
    • Previously: Global markets help Nike fly past estimates (June 29)
    • Shares of Nike are up 6.64% in premarket action.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM | 8 Comments
  • AIPT

    Skyline Medical soars after updating on Streamway

    • Skyline Medical (SKLN) issues an updates to shareholders.
    • The company says its most recent achievement was receiving notification that it can affix the CE mark to the Streamway system. The development allows Skyline to market and sell the Streamway in 32 European countries.
    • Skyline says that it's actively engaged in the process of assembling the proper distribution network and targeting specific markets to penetrate early.
    • A full European rollout of the Streamway system is expected to be completed by early 2018.
    • SKLN +18.32% premarket to $1.55.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 AM | 12 Comments
